sense.name: lack of agreement, not harmonious
sense.commentary: STRIFE[+state][+social][-agreement] Note: refers to a difference of opinion
sense.examples: There is strife within the community over the proposed housing project. Money can be a cause of strife in marriages. John tried to resolve the strife between Sally and his mother concerning the menu for the wedding reception.

sense.name: a struggle or intense conflict
sense.commentary: STRIFE[+activity][+conflict][+intense] Note: implies a struggle, sometimes violent
sense.examples: The treaty finally ended the ten-year strife between the nations. John doesn't mind the strife involved in climbing the corporate ladder. Ethnic and civil strife have been reported in some regions. The political strife in congress increases before an election.
